website_summaries.verdict: Brews 40 oz. of coffee in just 6 min. Features a stainless steel thermal carafe.
pros: Maintains a steady temperature for the water using a copper boiling element to ensure the highest possible coffee quality
Includes replaceable parts to ensure you can use the machine over the long term
Stainless steel thermal carafe maintains coffee temperature
cons: May experience some problems with water leaking during brewing process

website_summaries.verdict: The Moccamaster KBT 741 proves Technivorm's reputation for building exceptional drip coffee makers is well deserved.
pros: The Technivorm Moccamaster KBT 741 brews excellent, sometimes outstanding pots of drip coffee 10 cups at a time
It also has a lovely, elegant design and keeps coffee hot for a full 6 hours
cons: The Moccamaster KBT 741 is very expensive and takes up a large amount of counter space

customer_reviews.title: Brew basket has a serious design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The brew basket has a serious design flaw. You have to manually open and close the basket to stop the dripping. When you close the basket after making coffee in order to remove the carafe and you forget to open it the next time you are making coffee, you will have a huge mess at your hand. If you are leaving it open, the coffee will continue to drip slowly and make a little mess. The coffee is excellent, but we had many coffee disasters since we bought the machine at last Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Der Deutsche

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is expensive but if you enjoy the true flavor of the coffee you have purchased, this pot will let you enjoy that. All the K Cup coffee I have purchased taste the same. Not Good. I may be dreaming but I can definitely taste the difference in each coffee I try. Just a smooth flavor, not bitter. The quantity of coffee to use that the company suggest is way to much for me. You can arrive at the amount to use to your taste. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Beard

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Coffee Maker/Poor Service/Do not Buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this $300+ coffeemaker on February 15th, 2019. I cleaned it regularly (using the recommended cleaning agent) and it still failed to operate by November of 2019. It appears the heating element has stopped working. I tried calling the company regarding repairs, "They said to submit a written repair request to their .com website." Once again, I followed their instructions and after one week there has been no response. I'm tempted to try to fix this (very attractive but non-functional) pot myself, but my wife is sure it will invalidate the (worthless) warranty. My advice is save yourself frustration ... definitely don't buy this coffee maker. Paul
customer_reviews.author: Paul Schrag

customer_reviews.title: My favorite coffee maker...
customer_reviews.text: This makes the best coffee in the house. When I travel, I can't wait to get home to get my coffee. It's perfect every time. Love it and have purchased two.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E.

customer_reviews.title: Great durable cofee maker--that is a bargain over time
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Technivorm 79114 KBT Coffee Brewer for over three years. During that time, it has consistently day after day made great coffee. It's simple and does not have any bells and whistles but just does its job very well. I initially balked at the price, but then reflected on the fact that i had purchased two $150+ coffee makers over the last 4 years that made just ok coffee. This was an investment well worth it--I expect I will have it for another 5-10 years and over time it will actually become a bargain--all the while making me the best coffee I have ever had at home.
customer_reviews.author: Ross-Karlsen

customer_reviews.title: Cold coffee
customer_reviews.text: You do have to pre-heat the carafe with boiling water. The carafe does not keep the coffee as hot or warm as I would like (and I don’t like it very hot). Maybe the carafe’s tube (coffee transport mechanism) allows cooler air in, as I find the travel lid helps maintain the coffee temp.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K. Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Pice of junk.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee maker on 7 September 2019 and stopped working on 14 November 2019. I bought this junk for 309 US dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Dereje

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned about dropping this much money on a coffee maker but after my 3rd Mr.coffee in 5 years I was willing to give it a shot. It has been well worth it. I have only had mine for 2 months but I am very happy with it. It's simple design, coffee taste amazing, metal carafe keeps the coffee hot for hours, and it looks good IMHO. I usually make 1-2 10 cups a day and it consistently makes them in 4-6 min as advertised and its quite enough that Ive stood next to it doing something else and not known it was done.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee but bad design
customer_reviews.text: Cons first: The plastic parts are poorly designed. Easy to disturb something while brewing and make a mess. Why not leave it alone while brewing ? Can't, unless you want the filter to overflow. Needs constant tending to get best water distribution without overflow. Metal hot water arm rests directly on the rim of the (styrene?) cold water tank. After a year of regular use, the heat has caused the tank rim to start cracking. Pros: Water temp is precise and correct. Stainless thermal pot is high quality and keeps coffee not without venting flavor. For this money i expected much better engineering in a single purpose brewer.
customer_reviews.author: Constant Reader

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: We initially replaced a Bonavita with another Bonavita but the construction quality was poor. It did not empty the reservoir into the carafe so we returned it and order the Technivorm. The Technivorm does sacrifice a bit of practicality for design aesthetic and maybe a little cost savings (the reservoir cover is sort of cheesy and the foot that the carafe sits on is kind of lame). Those, however, are minor issues. The money is in the copper construction and water transport. This coffee maker is the best we have ever had. It makes great coffee. We are very satisfied with this purchase (have only had it for 2 weeks). Expensive, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Woods

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I had this product for less than a month it was working great. Then it just stopped working. An expensive machine, loved the coffee it made but very disappointed in durability. I purchased it based on reviews and it being hand made with quality components
customer_reviews.author: ray coniglio

customer_reviews.title: This makes the best coffee hands down of any drip coffeemaker I have ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes the best coffee hands down of any drip coffeemaker I have ever used. I am now spoiled when I go to work or a friends house to have coffee, as it just cant live up to coffee from this machine. I use 6 level spoon scoops per liter of water and get a great pot of coffee every single time.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Do not fall for the hype. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: An expensive counter ornament. First the spray head does NOT wet the coffee properly. This machine consistently produces poor coffee regardles of the variables. The best water, the best coffee, various grinds, every imaginable babysitting technique: stirring the grounds, slowing the discharge into the carafe, etc. The stainless carafe is horrible and stinks even though it is washed properly and dried. Overall this is just a massive waste of materials and money. Nothing tops plain and simple pour over, it's easier and consistently delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Quickmill CremaMaster

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee is Important
customer_reviews.text: I love great coffee. This unit makes great coffee really fast. Half a pot (6-8 cup) in under 5 minutes. It heats the water at a higher temp than inexpensive pots ensuring an excellent brew. If you fill it up with hot tap water and let sit for a few minutes before brewing, the coffee stays hot enough for hours. It has a screw-on lid that keeps it warm enough all day. If everything about coffee is important to you in taste, flavor, richness, strength, I recommend this model. I have used this same model for the past 2 years & when I moved out I decided to buy one. Coffee just wasn't the same after brewing with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rene E

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive and coffee not all that good.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it makes coffee. For the price, it surely should! Problems: The spray head doesn't fully saturate the grounds. You have to stand over it and rotate the grounds container to facilitate full saturation. Also, I'm not sure the water is quite hot enough. The coffee is bland and weak, but not the bitter taste of overly hot water. The bottom plate won't stay attached. The carafe won't pour smoothly. It does heat fairly fast. Finally, the coffee taste just isn't there. A kettle and a Melitta makes better coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Marhkco

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and rotten seller.
customer_reviews.text: Overflowed because basket opening to carafe was not properly functioning. Grinds not equally saturated. Lots of cheap pieces lead to frustration and waste. Spent more time cleaning up overflowed coffee than I did enjoying brewed coffee. Then seller only gave me partial refund claiming damage to unit. Was perfect when it left here and packaged in original packaging. Save the headache and frustration and choose the competitors maker. I did and am much happier with the quality and ease.
customer_reviews.author: Amandatory75

customer_reviews.title: Finally the best cup of coffee at home!
customer_reviews.text: After having used numerous coffee makers over the years, I finally insisted on spending the money for this mocha master. My experience so far was that a strong cup of coffee was also bitter. The mocha master seems to have solved the problem. It has a hefty price, but finally I have a coffee maker that seems to have been made just for me. Now finally my Starbuck’s French roast coffee in this coffee maker delivers a hearty cup of coffee with a rich balanced flavor. My only regret is that I didn’t get it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Croezen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, price point makes you think it's better.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it but honestly it was difficult making a good tasting coffee. My older Ninja Coffee Bar IQ brewed a better cup because of its tech. Ninja uses Sam concept as Technivorm but adds more tech to always make it a great cup of joe. It might not last as long as A mochamaster but it is always on point. Surprise no one has really made any meaningful review in comparison to Technivorm.
customer_reviews.author: J R

customer_reviews.title: probably the best home drip system
customer_reviews.text: probably the best home drip system. Not fancy, just gets the water really hot. I prefer this model because you have some control over how fast the coffee flows our of the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D Springer

customer_reviews.title: Measurement is key
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee I've had! But, you need to measure coffee to water very carefully. I have found that 6 scoops of coffee beans (I've only used Peet's French Roast so far) to the 8-cup water mark on the coffee brewer is just right! This makes excellent coffee with absolutely no bitterness. I use a little half-and-half in each cup to round out the flavor. Once you have the proportions to your liking, you'll never use any other coffee brewer. I had been using Tassimo latte with 2 shots of espresso. But the Moccamaster far surpasses that combo! VERY happy with this purchase: Chef's Illustrated hit the nail on the head with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Angie T.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have had this coffee maker for 9 months now and I can honestly say it was a great buy. I was very nervous about spending so much money on a coffee maker and I realized the negative reviews related to small details. The coffee is delicious and I am very thankful that I have it everyday while trapped working from home. One thing I make sure I do is clean it every 3 month with a descaler (Urnex dezcal 4 tsp / qt). I know coffee as I have been drinking since I was 12 years old. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Goatee man

customer_reviews.title: DELIVERS OUTSTANDING COFFEE!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a bean-grinding coffee nut for as long as i can remember. I have always catered to the pricey end of the coffee maker spectrum; always in search of the perfect cup of coffee without busting the bank. A year ago, my son bought a Moccamaster and I was astonished at the delicious, bold but silky brew this device produced. Even with so-so beans (decaf) the coffees was sumptuous. I bought this one and have not been disappointed -- I think the secret is in the temperature profile. Fast. Easy. I look forward to it every morning!
customer_reviews.author: D.D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this coffee maker for 1 week now. It makes fabulous coffee & simple to use. The coffee basket is flimsy but has no bearing on the delicious, hot coffee the machine produces. What actually makes this coffee maker so great is the copper heating element. It heats very quickly and to the temperature requried for that perfect cup of coffee. My husband and I are extremely pleased with this product. Does not take up anymore counter space than other coffee maker. It's unique style is eye catching & becomes a conversation topic! It is definitely worth the money--you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Gately

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to clean, Difficult coffee in the filter, Giraffe does not heat, Water not hot enough,The base comes apartIn doesn't lock into place, You have to ReplaceThe screw tops on the carafe once the coffee is brewed. The carafePours unevenlyAnd there's coffee spittle everywhere. I am a coffee loverAnd this is by far the most expensiveI, inadequate, Culbersome Machine Invented Without Ever having someoneTry it out Because it is sincerely flawed n many ways. The most regretable $300 ever. Do not wast your money.
customer_reviews.author: luis salcedo

customer_reviews.title: Think twice about the carafe
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the brewer. It has literally ruined average coffee for me. There really is a difference in the brew temp or other magic with these. HOWEVER, the carafe is marginal at best. This is an irritation for me but a deal breaker for my wife who can't understand why we let the coffee get cold in an hour. We either have to transfer it to a glass insulated carafe or reheat a cup in the microwave. I now am seriously entertaining dropping another $300 to get the model with a heater plate to maintain the temp after brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Northlander

customer_reviews.title: Just not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, I expected more. Sure, there's no programming, but it also doesn't even shut itself off - or visibly so. Both carafe caps are difficult - and requiring a MUST changeover from brewing is a pain. And the whole thing seems just so flimsy. Lots of plastic, caps don't screw one easy. I'll save myself LOTS of money next time and get almost anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Tapper

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Not for everyone, but I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: If you are considering a $300 coffee maker, then I am sure you have done your research and know what you are getting into. Simple. No frills. Extremely high quality. I've been using on a daily basis for about a month now. I was worried that I might have some buyers remorse, it is a $300 coffee maker after all, but I have no regrets. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JohnDoe

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.text: My morning coffee nightmares are over. The coffee is delicious and kept hot with the very durable carafe. It’s easy to clean, it’s counter space footprint is compact, and there’s no extraneous buttons. Ditch the removable carafe tray, it will never stay with the unit if you slide it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Henry

customer_reviews.title: One Great Cup of Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: For years, I've seen the reviews of the Technivorm Moccamaster and asked myself, how much better can this coffeemaker be? The answer is, a lot! Said my wife after the first cup, "you know, this isn't the cure for cancer, but it's a great cup of coffee. It's hot, it's not bitter, and it's full bodied flavor." We've burned through many coffeemakers in our life and I'm comforted by the five-year warranty but the thing that stands out so far is the outstanding brew that comes from this coffee maker that fits in perfectly with our mid-century modern design.
customer_reviews.author: Power User

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, a bit flimsy design
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted this coffee maker for quite some time but it was a bit expensive. I finally decided to buy it. First of all, the coffee is excellent which is the most important aspect. The reason I didn't rate this as high as others is that the design and quality of the maker is not up to what I was expecting for a $300 coffee maker. The materials are of somewhat flimsy plastic, especially the base that supports the thermos, and the cover that sits over the water container. Hoping it lasts for a while.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have done a lot of research before i bought this thing. I am satisfied with my results. My wife and I been drinking bad coffee for awhile. We love coffee and I didn't mind paying 300 for this machine, it was well worth it. It is easy to use, easy to clean, and it brews perfectly. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Elias

customer_reviews.title: Only if you care about coffee
customer_reviews.text: Best cup of coffee each day. Always. But then, if you're looking at this you already know what this can do to the macerated bean I own two. One for home and one on my houseboat. Because a day without coffee is, well . . . Actually I have no idea what a day without coffee would feel like. I can tell you how a day with bad coffee feels - BAD. drop the money and buy the best
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Decent tasting coffee, a real pain to clean and use.
customer_reviews.text: We followed the manufacturers instructions and used real Moccamaster filters, but the coffee tasted about the same (maybe slightly better) than a standard 10 cup coffee maker that we have used for years. This machine is a real pain to clean and use, if your grind is a little too fine, the water drips over the top. It disassembles into several pieces. It only fills the carafe about half-way, so need to make two batches to get enough coffee. Carafe is odd design that is not very usable. Overall very dissatisfied with this purchase, would return to Amazon but just past the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We now drink smaller cups of richer coffee. We used to have big mugs that we would drink our coffee from, but when we got this, we switched to smaller mugs. Seriously, the coffee is richer and we just do not need as much. My husband and I have both been really pleased with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: best homemade drip ever
customer_reviews.text: Makes awesome coffee, carafe keeps it hot for a couple hours, fun to watch the bubbles come up the tube in the reservoir, like the funky design. Only problem with this model is that the middle detent in the filter basket is pretty weak, so if you bump it accidentally it will move to full open or full closed. Full open not a problem, full closed can make for a surprising mess all over the kitchen counter. Still love it anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Akins

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I've been aware of this one for a long time but was trigger-shy due to the price. After several others I finally caved and bought it and I am not disappointed. I replaced the Oxo one with this. This is far easier to clean/maintain in my opinion and have no complaints with the quality of the brew. I like the fact that individual pieces are replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Loving the Moccamaster
customer_reviews.text: This is a substantial upgrade from my existing drip machine of ~$40. I've been a fan of Aeropress for a few years but many mornings I just don't feel like partaking in such a manual process. With fresh ground beans and filtered water the MoccaMaster makes a solid cup of coffee. It's extremely easy to clean and use and the coffee it makes has nearly the body and flavor of more manual methods like Aeropress or hand pourover. Definitely worth the investment if you're like me and want a good cup of coffee that you don't have to work so hard for.
customer_reviews.author: Brett B

customer_reviews.title: I hate to say that something drip makes coffee really well
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say that something drip makes coffee really well, and is expensive to boot, but this is. We tried a number of other pretenders and the Moccamaster is our choice. Reliable and consistent and remarkable in its performance. I still prefer a French press but my wife likes this one a lot and so do I.
customer_reviews.author: Emeritus

customer_reviews.title: The Coffee Tasts GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker after having researched numerous other makers on the market. Although it was a pricer option, I am very happy with my purchase and know that this maker will stand the test of time. The taste of the coffee is excellent. The maker is easy to clean and the time it takes to make coffee is not much longer than my former Keurig. Water heats up quickly! I'm very happy with my selection.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Fesperman

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee. Goofy design.
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker makes good coffee pretty fast atms is cool to watch. But the design has goofy ergonomics. The lids for the water and filter aren't hinged and are clumsy to deal with. The carafe is vacuum insulated but does a poor job keeping the coffee hot. Our old capresso carafe was far superior. If you pt the other serving lid on the carafe it's too tall to fit back on the coffee maker. There's a detachable drip plate under the carafe that loosly clips onto the coffee maker, clearly an afterthought. The filter drips coffee even if the little drip lever is closed.
customer_reviews.author: G Man

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It's fast and gives my pour-overs a run for its money when it comes to taste. I prefer being able to stop the drip for the pre-soak and stirring the clumps, so this model was perfect. Just don't forget to open the drip :) Wife likes her coffee prepped and ready in the morning, so a timer would be nice. I personally prefer fresh ground beans--but it takes 4min to brew 8-10 4oz cups, so it's not a big issue. This thing is as good as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Wo

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee but flimsy / fiddly parts
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this and it does make good coffee, but after admiring it in my friends kitchen I was really surprised how cheap and unsturdy the parts were once I got one. It’s very fiddly to put the filter / coffee thing on and the base plastic piece is also flimsy. The carafe on the other hand is amazing quality and feel. I would put it out on a brunch table any day. I just wish it all had more weight / quality feel to it, especially the parts you’re dealing with to make the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Colville

customer_reviews.title: Makes even cheap coffee taste good.
customer_reviews.text: I love the speed and taste of the coffee. Coffee that was terrible out of the old unit is much better when it is used in the Technivorm. The ergonomics could use some work, but it makes great coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Bosoliver Shagnasty

customer_reviews.title: Simple coffee maker for the best coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt sure because of the cost but it is worth it. Easy to use and clean and makes the best cup of coffee ever. That is true no matter how cheap or expensive the coffee is. The pot did leak at the handle when I got it ( purchased an open box) but Amazon was amazing and replaced it immediately. Also to all the reviews that complained about the plastic piece coming loose; it now has a lip that connects to the coffee maker and stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: V. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Seriously great coffee machine
customer_reviews.text: The stuff of legend. You can spend the same money on a digital drip that will do a million things - or you can just grab the ol’ standard that will do a bang up job every single time. For me - it’s why I wear a proper analog timepiece on my wrist over an Apple Watch. I got the thermal carafe over glass because I don’t love the idea of a separate heating element. If you’re looking for a drip machine - make the purchase and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Mine quit working after 3 months, and I cannot ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine quit working after 3 months, and I cannot find a phone number for customer service. Technivorm has no phone contacts on their product page. If they reach out to me based on this review and exchange or fix my Moccamaster, I will update this review and give more stars.
customer_reviews.author: southerngal

customer_reviews.title: Plastic parts are really flimsy and poorly fitting.
customer_reviews.text: I expected a solid construction on all the parts not just the metal and eternal parts. The carafe and the body were nice. The Water reservoir and coffee grind holder were flimsy plastic and didn't connect solidly with the main body. The lid on the water reservoir was similar. It was more like a kids toy quality plastic. Definitely not worthy of the $300+ price tag. I wouldn't be proud to have this sitting on my countertop.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I have used this coffee maker for several years and it is without a doubt the best one I have ever used, period. I have had continual compliments from everyone that has tried the coffee and all have said it is the best coffee that they have had. It is worth the price and I like this home-brewed coffee much better than anything at Starbucks.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie M

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the Hype
customer_reviews.text: Friends own another model & raved about it. We purchased the brand based on their recommendation & are very happy we did! This pot makes the best tasting coffee we’ve ever had from a home-owned pot. The carafe keeps coffee hot for hours. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Celentano

customer_reviews.title: Smooth cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Extraordinary coffeemaker. Taste is superb. I don't know the engineering behind it, but it makes a really smooth cup of coffee in little time. At first, you might think that the apparatus is not that well made. But I had mine for almost a year and used it daily. It holds up very well. If you like coffee and you want a really, really smooth cup of coffee, you will find that the price is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Lockey

customer_reviews.title: Please w/purchase
customer_reviews.text: My husband doesn't love any at-home coffeemakers but is willing to purchase another one of these for our vacation place. Success!
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Buy the auto-drip-shutoff version of filter holder
customer_reviews.text: Buy the auto-drip filter holder, not the manual version. The benefit of no-drip after every first pour is more important than occasionally having more precision when making a 1/2 pot of coffee (with manual setting). If you forget to flip the manual lever up after shutting off the flow, then the next pot of coffee runs down a channel on the outside of the filter holder (in to the pot, so at least there’s no mess) and basically ruins that pot of coffee. Go with the auto-shutoff version.
customer_reviews.author: jana hoeft

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Temperature!
customer_reviews.text: This one is super easy to clean! Same perfect 192deg temperature every time! That's why I bought it (recommendation from a guy who makes own coffee - Millars Coffee). Bought it 2-3yrs ago - Now outlasted any other pot I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.  Great coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Makes even Starbucks roasts seem palatable. Although I like coffee from the Chemex a little better, this is much easier to use. I don't have to loiter over the boiling kettle, monitor temps, and then spend 6-8 minutes executing a pour over. Worth the money. East to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee I have Ever Drank!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for a little while now and I have to say, I couldn't believe the difference in the taste. It will change you opinion of the coffee you drink. There is no better coffee pot on the market today.
customer_reviews.author: David Homoney

customer_reviews.title: My second Moccamaster--I remain a very happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first Moccamaster in 2009--brewed a pot of coffee with it every day I was home for 8 1/2 year. Heating coil started overheating the coffee, so bought this model as a replacement and I remain very happy. Very few changes with the new model because they got the first model right. Carafe with the new model has a marginally tighter seal so the coffee stays hot for an additional hour. If you drink filter coffee, this is the only coffeemaker you should consider.
customer_reviews.author: Hubert Horan

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that this is the best drip coffee maker I have ever used, or seen. The quality of the coffee is significantly better than the cheap drip machines you find. I was skeptical when a coffee aficionado friend was raving about the Moccamaster, but after using it for over a year, it is worth the price. It is very reliable and easy to maintain. In an era of throw away appliances, it is nice to see something made to last.
customer_reviews.author: techguy

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best drip system coffee maker I have owned. The consistency of the water temperature is impressive. I enjoy my coffee like never before. Make sure you descal this after every 100 brews and it will last decades.
customer_reviews.author: byron batz

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker this is my second one took the other to the fish camp and it was six years old and worked perfect just wanted the same great coffee !!! Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: R.D. Schultz Construction

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: The best feature of this machine is the thermal pot. It keeps the mediocre Coffee hot for hours. For the price point, I would expect a more durable design and coffee that is out of this world. If I had to do it again, I would buy one with a built in grinder for $200 less.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Moglia

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is very cheap - good coffee though!
customer_reviews.text: It made good, hot coffee but the plastic is so cheap!!! I sent it back and bought the OXO 9 cup coffee maker - which I prefer, especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: What a difference in taste. Can’t believe it’s the same coffee I used in the old pot. Which wasn’t very old bought new coffee pot 4 months ago and did not like it. This is an excellent coffee pot, easy to use and to clean I guess you pay for what you get. It is expensive but worth it wish I had heard about it years ago. I have bought more damn coffee pots and none were good. Try this one folks don’t think you’ll be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Coffee Maker!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a truly smooth and delicious pot of coffee. The coffee brews in minutes, and comes out at the perfect temperature. It looks beautiful on the counter top, and we get many compliments on the machine's looks, as well as the quality of coffee brewed. The carafe keeps the coffee warm for several hours when the lid is secured tightly. We have been very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: ... a lot of coffee makers and so many had good and bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: Looked at a lot of coffee makers and so many had good and bad reviews. This one seemed to have the least amount of bad reviews. Well, it's a great machine. Brews great coffee, and is really nice to own. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anil Baral

customer_reviews.title: FAST AND SIMPLE
customer_reviews.text: I have had this coffee maker a few weeks and I am very satisfied with it. It could not be simpler. It is so fast in making a cup of HOT coffee. It does not have timers but it is so fast and simple it is not missed. Now my biggest problem is deciding what brand of coffee I brew. So far, I have tried Starbucks, Dunkin which I like better than Burnt taste of Starbucks, 8 O'Clock, Caribou, Millstone and several styles of Peet's. So far, I probably like Major Dickason of Peet's best. It's been fun; hey, if you have a good coffee maker, you should have good coffee to go in it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting rich coffee
customer_reviews.text: Had a Keurig for years. Never was pleased with the quality of coffee. Always seemed watered down. Did lots of research on this machine. I couldn't be more pleased. My wife and I absolutely loved it. Became coffee aficionado. Coffee comes out perfect. A must have for the coffee lover
customer_reviews.author: kenneth

customer_reviews.title: you should have fixed this like Krupps has done 20 years ago in their machines
customer_reviews.text: No auto shutoff with this model! Indicator light stays on forever when unit is done brewing; problem is that I refill unit at night so it's ready for AM; if you forget to shut unit off, it will start to brew as soon as you position the carafe. Come on Dutch, you should have fixed this like Krupps has done 20 years ago in their machines. Other than that, the unit looks good and it brews a nice cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: LBM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome coffee!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research, and decided on the moccamaster. This was a great decision. It makes great coffee. We use french roast beans, and it makes some incredibly smooth coffee. It is important to follow their recommended amount of grounds. Love the non twist pouring spout. Just make sure you have enough cabinet height, because it is a bit taller than some automatic coffee makers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Technivorm Moccamaster. The first one broke by accident, my fault. I still swear by this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Ramos Mattei

customer_reviews.title: Great All Around Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: The Moccamaster is well-made, very easy to clean, and it makes great coffee. We gave up our old Cuisinart Grind and Brew unit and so happy we did!
customer_reviews.author: Antique Lover

customer_reviews.title: Love the look!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome coffee maker. Needed to buy a new coffee maker after our 2nd Bunn velocity died. Our water has a high about of calcium, after about 6 months I would have to disassemble the Bunn and clean it out with lime away. After about 4 cleanings they both stopped working. Decided to buy this after reading several reviews. It is almost as fast as the Bunn, but a lot easier to clean. Love the look.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Bury

customer_reviews.title: 30 year coffee roaster very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Ok I don't ever lost reviews but had to. I am a commercial coffee roaster and commercial coffee equipment manufacturer 30 years in the business. I will tell you that even me, I have put off buying this brewer for many years. I can tell you that without any question this brewer is worth the money. I hate to admit that it works better than expected. It makes the same or better coffee that I can make with a precise hot water boiler and very good cone filter. I now will be now contacting the manufacturer to sell these brewers to my coffee customers because they do work so well. Todd Millar Millars Organic Wood Roasted Coffee
customer_reviews.author: Todd Millar

customer_reviews.title: Our Second one, A+
customer_reviews.text: We had one about 10 years ago and it was great, this is well worth the extra cost, makes a fine coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Estel J. Hines

customer_reviews.title: Damn good coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far and away the best coffee maker I have ever owned. It’s super simple, but it simply makes a great cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Londgren

customer_reviews.title: This coffee maker is recommended by America's Test Kitchen and it does live up ...
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is recommended by America's Test Kitchen and it does live up to their standard of a good cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Mona G. Bond

customer_reviews.title: In love with it.
customer_reviews.text: I can't think of anything about this product I don't love. I visited my Mom for the holidays and she had one, the best coffee I have had, and I'm a big fan of black coffee, I was blown away. It looks cool as well so that doesn't hurt, looks and flavor, yes and yes!
customer_reviews.author: Shimmy

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Machine
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine is expensive but worth it! It brews an amazing cup of coffee at just the right temperature in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Dixon

customer_reviews.title: World's Best Coffee Brewer
customer_reviews.text: Now - this is the way to make coffee. They did the science, they did the engineering. The water is heated to the perfect temperature. The brewing cycle is done at the optimum time. Coffee goes into a thermal carafe that keeps it perfect for hours.
customer_reviews.author: SitkaCedar

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: Coffee maker is beautiful and makes great coffee, one star deducted because the shower arm doesn't evenly saturate the grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Tate

customer_reviews.title: The best coffee I've brewed at home
customer_reviews.text: The best coffee I've brewed at home! Moccamaster has changed coffee drinking in my house. My husband and I love using the Moccamaster because it brews perfect cup of coffee and doesn't take long like typical coffee makers. The carafe is also great for keeping the freshly brewed coffee hot for longer time than glass carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Chang

customer_reviews.title: Makes every brand of coffee delicious
customer_reviews.text: Love this drip maker! A big step up from my old Capresso. Took time to learn which ground coffee tasted best, as maker does not recommend changing their recommended coffee formula. We experienced leakage when we used heaping spoonfuls, against recommendation, to make coffee taste stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker for coffee connoisseurs
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are coffee aficionados. We have been looking to replace our coffee maker with one that give us more of a pour-over result, we found that with the Moccamaster. The product is well made and the best part is that it’s simple. It’s a great coffee maker and that’s all it’s trying to be!
customer_reviews.author: NATHAN P SNOOK

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Value
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth $300! The product is plastic and does not fit together very well. It does not produce better tasting coffee. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Best coffeemaker ever!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Such a difference with any other coffeemaker we have had! It is basic, no frills. No clock, no automatic shut off. It took me a couple of days to get used to that. However the coffee tastes great, stays tasting great for a long time ( we have the aluminum jar), and we use so much less coffee... in a year we’ll have recovered the cost of the coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No frills but makes great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant when I first opened the box. This much money for this. But after using it, I wouldn’t give it away. Simple. Easy to clean. Makes great coffee.
customer_reviews.author: EngineeringMom

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee maker. We had one of the same manufacturer for many many years, then recently it had a crack in it. It is really easy to use and makes great coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: The coffee brews quickly and delivers the VERY hot water needed to extract the best from the grounds
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as advertised. The coffee brews quickly and delivers the VERY hot water needed to extract the best from the grounds. We love this brewer and it's totally worth the money. My only wish for any future model would be a slightly bigger capacity as a "full pot" is only enough for 3 reasonably large mugs of coffee, where 4 would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair K Harper

customer_reviews.title: Makes a real nice pot of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, coffee comes out great. Lots of parts, had me worried something would break, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Stretch44

customer_reviews.title: Moccamaster IS superior!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cup of coffee. Very smooth tasting coffee (we use the McDonald's Columbia blend) Easy to assemble. Very quiet while brewing. Had no heavy plastic or factory smell. Well made product. FINALLY a great coffee maker! Best of all NOT made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda&Dwaine H

customer_reviews.title: Best brewer ever
customer_reviews.text: Second one I’ve ever owned, makes the best brewed coffee . My absolute favorite machine. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: nan

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetically pleasing Mr. Coffee
customer_reviews.text: The design is the biggest asset of this product- it’s gorgeous. Coffee is just ok. The cost of the unit did not correspond to the quality of the coffee. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: noelfinney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband and he loves it! Totally worth the price! Best way to enjoy a cup of joe!
customer_reviews.author: Martian on Earth

customer_reviews.title: The mother of all coffee makers
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this product looks. The coffee brewed is just exceptional and professional grade. Spend the money. Get this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: H. Giles

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: Having had a Chemex for years, and even the automatic drip version in the '80's, we are very pleased with the Technivorm. Only 4 stars because, like others have mentioned, the pouring quality of the carafe should be better. It takes a bit of practice to not have it splashing all over. However, the carafe does keep the coffee HOT! Definitely worth the price if you like smooth coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Sagmoore Cottage

customer_reviews.title: Top Choice
customer_reviews.text: My coffee oriented husband loves this coffee maker. He thinks this is the best out there. He has actually given up his coffee press for this.
customer_reviews.author: KatoKat

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee every time!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using my machine heavily everyday since I’ve been on lockdown. I really like this coffee maker!! Great coffee every time. Easy to use and clean. Looks great on my countertop. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Remy G.

customer_reviews.title: Best of the bunch NO frills
customer_reviews.text: Makes perfect coffee. NO buzzers whistles or extra feature just a solid simple coffee maker with a 5 year warranty. Glad I purchased this love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: William F.

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this coffee maker, it's extremely fast, and very quiet. I haven't had any problems with the coffee spilling out or anything like some others had mentioned but it does have a button the lights up when the thermos is in the correct position to receive the coffee and as long as I've made sure the thermos is in the right position, the coffee lands where it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Stacey

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Leaked water first try! Poorly packaged between shipping box and machine box. Made great coffee, just leaked 1/4 the water out the bottom of the machine as it was making it. Nice machine however.
customer_reviews.author: David Roper

customer_reviews.title: Clean right after use
customer_reviews.text: Looovvee. Coffee at home is now my favorite coffee ever. We have it set up and no matter what coffee we brew it tastes good. We tend to use Lavassa. We clean it right away to make it easy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Gaston

product_meta.title: Technivorm Moccamaster 79112 KBT Coffee Brewer, 40 oz, Polished Silver
product_meta.description: Color:Polished SilverThe Moccamaster kbt 79112 Coffee maker features a thermal carafe and a manual-adjust, drip-stop brew-basket which provides adjust -ability in how fast Coffee flows into the carafe. The kbt brews a full 40oz pot of Coffee in six minutes. The thermal carafe will keep your Coffee hot up to an hour. To keep Coffee hot longer or for traveling with your carafe, switch to the included travel lid. All Moccamaster Coffee makers are handmade in the Netherlands and backed by an industry leading 5-year. Removable parts Essential for long-term maintenance and replacement.Pre-immersion drip-style system ensures the perfect coffee bloom, produced by an ultra–precise, natural pulse action
feature_bullets: The top coffee maker choice of coffee brewing experts
Easy use, one button Operation and 4-6 minute brew time for 40 oz. of Coffee
Manual adjust brew basket allows you to customize your Coffee
This Coffee maker features a stainless steel thermal carafe to keep Coffee hot longer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,066 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
